thread.title: Almost 12,000 miles away from Arsenal's Emirate home, Wenger Out banner spotted at New Zealand vs Fiji!
thread.title_full: Almost 12,000 miles away from Arsenal's Emirate home, Wenger Out banner spotted at New Zealand vs Fiji!

author: Mark Jones
title: Almost 12,000 miles away from Arsenal's Emirate home, Wenger Out banner spotted at New Zealand vs Fiji!
text:
Sport Almost 12,000 miles away from Arsenal's Emirate home, Wenger Out banner spotted at New Zealand vs Fiji! The fans' campaign to get rid of the Arsenal boss has been growing and growing in recent weeks, and it suddenly became even weirder in Wellington Share These banners seem to get everywhere (Photo: Getty Images / Twitter) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
They say that there is a time and a place for everything, but you'd think that this wouldn't be it. 
At Tuesday morning's World Cup qualifier between New Zealand and Fiji in Wellington, the first thing that you noticed was that only around 500 people had turned up to the 35,000 seater stadium. Then then second thing you noticed was that some of them had brought a Wenger Out banner. 
Yep, it seems as though the campaign against the Arsenal manager has spread to the Southern Hemisphere now - almost 12,000 miles away from the Emirates Stadium. 
There is quite literally no escape for the Gunners boss. It never rains but it pours, eh? (Photo: REUTERS) 
The Frenchman - who in recent days has seemed to indicate that he wants to stay at the club - was the subject of a banner spotted at the qualification clash, which New Zealand won 2-0. 
And not surprisingly, Twitter users who spotted it were a bit shocked. 
The banner comes hot on the heels of another Wenger Out sign being spotted at a music festival in Miami, as the craze continues to spread across the globe. 
Where will one show up next? 
We're going with the moon. poll loading What should Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger do? 15000+ VOTES SO FAR
